traceability.evidence: - bin/dry-aged-deps.js implements process.exit(0|1|2) for no-updates, updates-available and error paths (see lines ~540–560). - CLI tests verify exit codes: • test/cli.upToDate.test.js asserts exitCode 0 when dependencies up-to-date. • test/cli.check-mode.test.js asserts exitCode 1 for safe updates in table, JSON and XML, and exitCode 2 on invalid format. • test/cli.error-cmd.test.js and test/cli.format-xml.error.test.js assert exit codes for parse errors (1 in default, 2 in XML). • test/cli.config-file.test.js covers exitCode 2 on invalid config scenarios. - Documentation in README.md documents --check exit code semantics (0=none, 1=updates, 2=error). - --help output (bin/dry-aged-deps.js) includes: “Check mode: exit code 1 if safe updates available, 0 if none, 2 on error.”
traceability.notes: All acceptance criteria for standardized exit codes are met: the CLI emits the three required exit codes across formats, tests cover all scenarios, and the behavior is documented in README and help. Existing non-check behavior remains backward compatible.
